thread.title: Conway to get steakhouse named for pro golfer John Daly
thread.title_full: Conway to get steakhouse named for pro golfer John Daly

title: Conway to get steakhouse named for pro golfer John Daly
text:
Conway to get steakhouse named for pro golfer John Daly By - Associated Press   
CONWAY, Ark. (AP) - A mixed-use development in downtown Conway is set to bear the name of professional golfer John Daly. 
The Log Cabin Democrat (http://bit.ly/1PmNg1y ) reports John Daly’s and The Lofts at 912 will be a combination of a steakhouse and living spaces in a condemned building. The building’s makeover will cost around $1.5 million. 
Adam Waldron, chief financial officer for developer S.A.M. Group LLC, said the ground-floor steakhouse and bar would feature Daly memorabilia. Daly lived in Dardanelle and attended the University of Arkansas. 
The second floor of the development would have 2,500 feet of living space made up of four furnished lofts. 
The project was announced Wednesday during the annual meeting of the Conway Downtown Partnership. Waldron says developers are aiming for an April opening.
